ref: 13591 *sēlli ʻ cord ʼ. [J. Bloch BSOS viii 413 derives from *saila -- ~ saira -- ʻ belonging to a plough ʼ from sīla -- , sīˊra -- : this leaves Pk. unexpl. Derivation from *sētlī<-> ~ sḗtra -- (√si) is phonet. difficult ( -- ll -- < -- tl -- ?)]
S. selhī f. ʻ hair rope ʼ;
L. selhī, sehlī f. ʻ hair rope, rope for tying calf when milking cow ʼ;
P. selhī, selī f. ʻ necklace of thread or hair ʼ;
Bi. sel, selī ʻ hair cord tied from neck to feet of calf when milking cow ʼ;
H. selī f. ʻ thread necklace ʼ;
G. selī f. ʻ string of tinder ʼ, selɔ m. ʻ rope to tie hind legs of cow when being milked ʼ.
